job_title: Clinical Registered Dietitian in Columbus, OH
pros: Family feel; community-based; great coworkers.
cons: New changes and pay system are detrimental to pay.

review_title: Supportive organization that provides compassionate healthcare to the community
pros: Culture, Community based organization, Caring people
cons: Compensation, Rapid turnover, Many competitors drawing business and employees away

pros: Nothing I can think of.
cons: Outsourced employee jobs after having a consulting company come in. Was told we would be showing them our processes to improve our jobs and jobs were secure.

pros: Good people to work with
cons: Poor communication, pay int good

pros: Autonomy. Support of leadership team.
cons: Small community hospital. Not much room for advancement.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) in Lancaster, OH
pros: Absolutely LOVE the environment, and my coworkers! Pulmonologists allow you to do your job, and take initiative on patient care when they trust you. The workers are there for the patients, and it shows. The RT’s work very well as a team, including the supervisor, to whom does well more than what is expected. You would not be just a treatment jockey here. You can be signed off to insert A-Lines, intubate, and much more.
cons: The manager is inconsistent, manipulative, and likes to make up her own rules, then will turn around and say that is not what happened.

pros: Pay is close to industry standard
cons: Management is ruthless in demeaning employees. Benefits are the worst I have ever seen at a company that employs this many full-time workers.

review_title: Great place to start your career
job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Lancaster, OH
pros: everyone is friendly and kind. Starting pay is great as well as a sign on bonus. Patients become family
cons: Limited in office resources. Disorganization within the system. Pay structure could be better at just salary rather than productivity.

pros: Great people and great culture
cons: Concerns with the financial stability of the organization

pros: Very personable. It is often you will see the President in the hallway or visiting your unit. Very fun people to work with.
cons: If you pick up extra shifts they will call you a lot when they need nurses.

pros: great coworkers, they keep you busy
cons: management is okay, more staff would be beneficial

pros: Great place to work as a nursing assistant
cons: I can’t think of anything as a con

job_title: Desktop Support Technician in Lancaster, OH
pros: Good Culture with emphasis on all levels to be kind and supportive to each other and the patients.
cons: Below Industry standard pay and often asked to wear too many hats.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Lancaster, OH
pros: Autonomy, flexible scheduling, great staff
cons: Worked alone most days, no one to bounce ideas off of

pros: Community focused with amazing culture and family focus
cons: not a lot of growth opportunities

job_title: Director of Food and Nutrition Services in Lancaster, OH
pros: Continue to improve the culture
cons: long hours and staff turnover

pros: Opportunity to work with leading Lancaster physicians in a specialty practice.  Great medical experience for qualified medical professionals to work close to home.
cons: Poor management by FHP Director, no Policies and Procedures manual, incredibly high employee turnover. Physicians, patients and employees are held hostage to profits.  Knee jerk policies are enacted with little regard for physician's or their patient's well-being.

pros: Convenient if you live in Fairfield County but not much else in the way of positives. There is a core of good  people but they get frustrated and overworked.
cons: No consistency in policies or workflows. Talks a big game about corporate culture but promotes bad behavior in the lack of integrity with Administration and HR. Horrible pay, no chance of advancement. Overall lack of knowledge of basic healthcare practices and regulations and very behind the times with operational structure.

pros: I love the way when you work here you feel like family. Your job is what you make of it, PERIOD, and if you go in with a positive attitude you will love working here. Its not always going to be a good day, but you leave it at the door, and you have a good day. Pay was decent and all the extra things you can get involved in made it so worth it. LOVED MY JOB truly, the culture made it!
cons: I mean besides the crappy attitudes sometimes, and malfunctioning equipment( that don't get me wrong got fixed quickly). There is always something that can go wrong in a day though.

pros: There are zero pros for working here - don't do it
cons: The health insurance is very expensive for very little coverage and requires a bio-metric screening that affects the price you pay.  The administration is very grey on everything when it comes to holding their employees responsible for adhering to deadlines, following rules, and safety protocols.  The pay is very low for the job that you do and most of the employees are very lazy in completing their work which results in them hiring only the people who don't really care to begin with.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Lancaster, OH
pros: My coworkers were great to work with.
cons: I got injured at work. I am going out for surgery to get it fixed after being in pain for a year and a half. Since I’m part time I don’t qualify for Fmla. They are posting my job instead of holding it for me even though I would be back before the new person was trained. I feel given the fact that I was hurt AT WORK they should hold my position. I feel discriminated against and am currently being treated poorly which will continue until my last day before surgery.

pros: Cannot think of one positive thing about the experience. Benefits are not great. Top heavy on management.  Wastes resources on things that don't matter.
cons: This place is like an outdated high school. Adult bullies everywhere. No integrity. Everyone from the C-Suite down is living in their own alternate reality. There is no honesty and anyone who tries to do things by the book is immediately ostracized. They talk about culture and don't lead by example. People with seniority are allowed to terrorize new employees with fresh ideas. It's as though they are stuck in the 1950's and want to stay there.

review_title: Third rate facility.  Nurses sat at the nurses station all night on their phones ignoring lights and alarms.
job_title: ED Registered Nurse in Lancaster, OH
pros: I cannot personally think of any great reasons to work here.  There are some exceptionally good nurses who aren't appreciated and are passed over, managed by idiots.
cons: Management has no consistency in it's policy enforcement.  Threatened by people with experience in other healthcare facilities with knowledge and ideas to improve the place.  Managers have the level of importance all mixed up.  It's the people who work the floors that matter, who work with the patients. They are the most valuable assets..not management and their cronies.  The same people over and over in their Monday morning..earning cracker jack awards.

pros: Good stability for the average person if you are just looking for a job to pay the bills. It was a good place to develop your work force skills.
cons: People worry to much about others. Some people try to stay out of the work force drama and it can lead to others not caring for you to much.

job_title: Medical Office Specialist in Lancaster, OH
pros: I loved working at FMC. Everyone is so nice and you make great friends with your coworkers. I have worked every shift there and liked them all. I grew a lot at FMC. Wish I was still there.
cons: We went through a lot of supervisors at my last clinic I worked at in FMC

pros:
On-campus Cafeteria
Cultural Transformation (work in progress)
Great place for women
Growth opportunities
Paid Training
cons:
Parking situation (not enough parking so sometimes you're looking at a half mile from car to desk at minimum)
Pay is a lot lower than surrounding health systems

pros: Community Oriented.   Close knit culture.    Center provides excellent care.
cons: Wages and benefits do not meet the job expectations.   Senior leadership not always in tune with what is really happening.

pros: Clean easy access. Pleasant employees that work well together. Good education department and school of nursing from Mt Carmel in the building
cons: Top heavy with management and overhead. Keep cutting out the help below and work short handed but never downsize administration

pros: Lots of benefits, employee discounts, pto is awesome
cons: Very high school, lots of favoritism among managements and certain nurses . Says open door policy but not really.

pros: Local, in town, more convenient than traveling to Columbus for work
cons: Benefits package is terrible, don't play employees what they are really worth

pros: Working around all the different people every day was a different challenge.
cons: Sadness of some of the sick and hurting going on.

pros: Decent pay, good pto,
cons: Management not readily available.  Too many cliques and high school drama. The culture they brag about is nowhere to be seen. I've seen many people leave because of this one reason.  Many, many adult bullies here!

pros: team work, fair competitive pay great benefits
cons: i dont have any complaints with this emplyer very fair and understanding

pros: Great people, short commute, same salary as Columbus hospitals.
cons: No raises, only left because of Press-Ganey creating monsters out of people!

pros: The food was awesome 👏
cons: Had to walk a mile to get anywhere and my boss was a married couple and was horrible to work for

pros: Great potential, good docs and some very nice people
cons: Low pay, poor administration, policies not upheld, run by the good ol’ boys club, HR not helpful, hostile environment

pros: Great department to work for, flexible, great for going to college schedules.
cons: Management is not that great

pros: Nice people, clean, community hospital
cons: Low pay, rural area, long commute

job_title: Rad Rat in Happy Valley, OR
pros: Wonderful co workers.  A privilege to serve the community.
cons: Way too much unprofessional junior high school drama. No accountability of management.  Employees allowed to do what they wish despite standard policies.

pros: Pto is not to bad.
cons: Job security is very scary.
